intro.text: London feels wrong. Not loud-wrong—coordinated-wrong. Posters appear overnight. Chants sync like metronomes. The city is learning to march.

choices.label: Review reports and head into the city

london_hub.text: You arrive near Westminster. Police lines are calm. Too calm. Cameras pivot as if they recognize you.

choices.label: Investigate the speeches in Trafalgar Square (gain: propaganda)
Trace the camera network and patrol routes (gain: surveillance)
Follow the money and logistics behind the rallies (gain: coordination)
Check the Grimoire and compare your notes
Occult stationer: buy Iron Ink (cost: 2 Obols)
Print shop: steal Iron Ink (free, −1 Humanity)
Do a small job for an informant (gain: 2 Obols)

hint_grimoire.text: You withdraw to a quiet place and open the Clavicula Salomonis. Patterns begin to form. The names are old, but their methods are modern.

choices.label: If identified, prepare a seal (go to Craft tab)

prepare_seal.text: A demon of Conquest will not submit to crude ink. You’ll need a proper seal—clean lines, correct materials, no hesitation.

choices.label: Attempt confrontation (requires: Seal of the Herald)

confront.text: You step into the flow of the crowd. The chant changes around you—subtly—and for a moment you feel the city thinking with one mind.

choices.label: Press the seal and speak the binding (consume seal, lose humanity, attempt bind)

after_confront.text: The moment passes. The city exhales. Whatever moved beneath the crowd withdraws… for now.

seal_success.text: The seal bites into the air like a lock snapping shut. The crowd exhales. Whatever coordinated the city withdraws—contained, for now.

end.text: You leave the case alone. London continues to learn its new rhythm. (Demo end.)
